channel.title: Comments on: Monday Go Meditation: Game 40

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Haha. Hopefully you'll be in for a pleasant surprise!
item.content:encoded: Haha. Hopefully you’ll be in for a pleasant surprise!

item.title: By: saxmaam
item.dc:creator: saxmaam
item.description: I love that these reviews are becoming more tutorial. Thanks for putting in the effort! As you know, I'm reading the whole blog from the beginning. Can't wait to see what comes next :)
item.content:encoded: I love that these reviews are becoming more tutorial. Thanks for putting in the effort! As you know, I’m reading the whole blog from the beginning. Can’t wait to see what comes next ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: While you may think that, I wouldn't be surprised if you were actually stronger than him. I've seen dan players review 1k games and ask them why they were making 9k moves. xD Haha. But regardless, I hope that this was interesting and valuable to you!
item.content:encoded: While you may think that, I wouldn’t be surprised if you were actually stronger than him. I’ve seen dan players review 1k games and ask them why they were making 9k moves. xD Haha. But regardless, I hope that this was interesting and valuable to you!

item.title: By: flippertie
item.dc:creator: flippertie
item.description: As a KGS 7k - the moves you were surprised at seem like the sort of things I'd have played :-p The score also suggests he was about my rank...
item.content:encoded: As a KGS 7k – the moves you were surprised at seem like the sort of things I’d have played :-p The score also suggests he was about my rank…

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Understandable. In fact, I've had the reverse happen where opponents supposedly 3-4 stones weaker than me actually ended up surprising me. xD Definitely an interesting phenomenon.
item.content:encoded: Understandable. In fact, I’ve had the reverse happen where opponents supposedly 3-4 stones weaker than me actually ended up surprising me. xD Definitely an interesting phenomenon.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: To be honest, I don't know. I think that's one of the major flaws with OGS. You just don't know what kind of rank you'll actually be playing against. It kind of messes with the game a bit in my opinion.
item.content:encoded: To be honest, I don’t know. I think that’s one of the major flaws with OGS. You just don’t know what kind of rank you’ll actually be playing against. It kind of messes with the game a bit in my opinion.

item.title: By: Xezlec
item.dc:creator: Xezlec
item.description: I say that because I sometimes beat people 5+ ranks above me just because they're unprepared for my stupidity and overthink their moves. So I think sometimes people don't realize how dumb their opponents are.
item.content:encoded: I say that because I sometimes beat people 5+ ranks above me just because they’re unprepared for my stupidity and overthink their moves. So I think sometimes people don’t realize how dumb their opponents are.

item.title: By: Xezlec
item.dc:creator: Xezlec
item.description: Hmm... are you sure this guy is at your level?
item.content:encoded: Hmm… are you sure this guy is at your level?

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: You're absolutely right. I got caught up thinking my group was in trouble. Always glad to get your insight! =)
item.content:encoded: You’re absolutely right. I got caught up thinking my group was in trouble. Always glad to get your insight! =)

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: I think w42 is an example of a thank-you move: it invites black to play what he would want to anyway (B10) *in sente*. Why not just ignore? Black keeps the left side either way - it's just a question of some points. Your corner was solid - you weren't going to die.
item.content:encoded: I think w42 is an example of a thank-you move: it invites black to play what he would want to anyway (B10) *in sente*. Why not just ignore? Black keeps the left side either way – it’s just a question of some points. Your corner was solid – you weren’t going to die.
